The goal of this challenge is to get you more comfortable with RStudio, git, Github, and submitting assignments through Github.  You will need to:

1. [Initialize a new project in RStudio.](#initialize-a-new-project)

2. [Make changes to R code in an Rmarkdown file.](#hack-some-r-code)

3. [Knit the Rmarkdown file to generate an HTML report](#knit-the-rmarkdown)

4. [Commit the changes you made to the Rmarkdown file and the HTML report you generated](#commit-changes)

5. [Submit your work by pushing changes to Github](#submit-your-work)

# Initialize a New Project
1. On the main page for **this Github repository** click on the *Clone or download* button.
2. In the dialog box that posp up, click "Use SSH", then click on the clipboard icon to copy the repo URL.
3. In RStudio use the New Project command (from the Project menu)
4. Choose "Version Control" in the *Create Project* dialog box
5. Choose Git
6. Paste the repo URL into the *Repository URL*.  It should be something like `git@github.com:IBIEM/challenge_1.git`, but with your Github username as part of it.
7. For *Project directory name* put `challenge_1`
8. Leave *Create project as subdirectory of* as "~"
9. Click Create Project.
